bug.author: Maleandr
bug.description: Hi, I have custom CNN model trained and exported in TF 1.7.1 (which should be currently supported version), but I got error message while loading graph: {TensorFlow.TFException: NodeDef mentions attr 'dilations' not in Op<name=Conv2D; signature=input:T, filter:T -> output:T; attr=T:type,allowed=[DT_HALF, DT_FLOAT]; attr=strides:list(int); attr=use_cudnn_on_gpu:bool,default=true; attr=padding:string,allowed=["SAâ€¦} I found some advices about TF version, but TF 1.7.1 should be supported right? I'm little bit confused, because calling TFCore.Version gives me "1.1.0-rc2", which is 1 year old TF version.

comments.comment: hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Maleandr>@Maleandr</denchmark-link> thank you for your email. this seems to be a bug with the TFS plugin. let me do some looking around

Thank you for reply. Do you have any update please <denchmark-link:https://github.com/unityjeffrey>@unityjeffrey</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/xiaomaogy>@xiaomaogy</denchmark-link> ?

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Maleandr>@Maleandr</denchmark-link> Did you download the latest TF# plugin ? <denchmark-link:https://s3.amazonaws.com/unity-ml-agents/0.4/TFSharpPlugin.unitypackage>Here</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/vincentpierre>@vincentpierre</denchmark-link> Yes I did. It works for you?
Hmm I have downloaded and imported it again and now it shows "1.7.0", but "1.7.1" should be supported right? <denchmark-link:https://github.com/vincentpierre>@vincentpierre</denchmark-link>

This NodeDef mentions attr 'dilations' not in Op<name=Conv2D error is usually thrown when the TF version is off. If you are sure your model was trained with the same version as TF#, then it should work. It could also be the case that you are using Con2D with a dilation argument that we do not use in our InternalBrain. Please look at how we do convolutions in the PPO trainer and make sure you are using convolutions in the same way. If you want to be sure, you could train the GridWorld and try to use the trained model with the InternalBrain. If it does work, then this means there is an issue in the way you use convolutions in your model.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/vincentpierre>@vincentpierre</denchmark-link> My issue is not with 'dilations' - me '1.7.0' now, but you mention in documentation '1.7.1' as supported version. I don't know what version of TF should be used then.

Your issue states that If the issue you are seeing is different, could you post it here ? The difference between 1.7.0 and 1.7.1 is <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/compare/v1.7.1...r1.7>very small</denchmark-link> so I do not think you can have an issue due to incompatibility between those versions. It seems 1.7.1 works with the current TF# plugin.

Well I downloaded TF# plugin again and it worked, but I was confused because of difference between '1.7.0' in TF# plugin and '1.7.1' in documentation. I understand that diff between 1.7.0 and 1.7.1 is very small. Thank you for help.
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
